title: Not ready for parallel processing
body:
#### What is the problem?

Recent switch to parallel indexing of metadata triggered a condition that leads to parallel access to repo instances. I do not yet know what the pattern is exactly, but it is clear that I do not have a concept on how to tell datalad to not screw up in this situation.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```
% datalad search female --reindex
[INFO   ] Rebuilding search index 
[INFO   ] Scanning for metadata keys 
[INFO   ] Added 2 documents on dataset . 
[INFO   ] Added 134 documents on dataset ds000001 
Exception IOError: IOError("Lock at '/tmp/openfmri/.git/index.lock' could not be obtained",) in <bound method AnnexRepo.__del__ of <AnnexRepo path=/tmp/openfmri (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)>> ignored
Exception IOError: IOError("Lock at '/tmp/openfmri/.git/index.lock' could not be obtained",) in <bound method AnnexRepo.__del__ of <AnnexRepo path=/tmp/openfmri (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)>> ignored
[INFO   ] Added 280 documents on dataset ds000002 
[INFO   ] Added 389 documents on dataset ds000006 
Exception IOError: IOError("Lock at '/tmp/openfmri/.git/index.lock' could not be obtained",) in <bound method AnnexRepo.__del__ of <AnnexRepo path=/tmp/openfmri (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)>> ignored
...
```
